    • Method Detail

      • addAnalysisClasses

        public void addAnalysisClasses(Collection<String> classes)
        Adds classes to the set of analysis classes. The analysis classes are the set of classes through which constant propagation should take place.
        Parameters:
        classes - A collection of classes.

      • isAnalysisClass

        public boolean isAnalysisClass(String clazz)
        Determines if a class is an analysis class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - A fully-qualified class name.
        Returns:
        True if the argument class is an analysis class.

      • getAnalysisClasses

        public Set<String> getAnalysisClasses()
        Gets the set of analysis classes.
        Returns:
        The set of analysis classes.

      • isIterative

        public boolean isIterative()
        Determines if the analysis is iterative. Currently all analyses should be iterative. The default value is true.
        Returns:
        True if the analysis is iterative.

      • setIcfg

      • setInferNonModeledTypes

        public void setInferNonModeledTypes(boolean inferNonModeledTypes)
        Sets whether hotspot values should be inferred for values that are not modeled using COAL. The COAL language allows method arguments with primitive values (string, int, etc.) to be specified as hotspots. This flags specifies if such values should be inferred. Note that in order to infer these values, argument analyses have to be specified for them using registerArgumentValueAnalysis. The default value is true.
        Parameters:
        inferNonModeledTypes - The value of the flag.

      • inferNonModeledTypes

        public boolean inferNonModeledTypes()
        Determines whether hotspot values should be inferred for values that are not modeled using COAL.
        Returns:
        True if hotspot values should be inferred for values that are not modeled using COAL.

      • useShimple

        public boolean useShimple()
        Determines if the analysis should be performed using Shimple (SSA representation).
        Returns:
        True if the analysis should be performed using Shimple.

      • v

        public static AnalysisParameters v()
        Returns the singleton instance for this class.
        Returns:
        The singleton instance for this class.
